Execution Summary
The impact of the novel coronavirus on the illicit drug market.
Its impact may be similar to the 2008 economic crisis.
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the world into a crisis unseen before.

In many countries, this disease has overwhelmed medical service institutions, pushing them to the brink of collapse, and government-imposed restrictions have caused severe disruption in the global economy.
The impact of the epidemic on the drug market is still unclear and difficult to predict, but it is likely to be significant.
Some producers may be forced to seek new methods to manufacture illicit drugs, as restrictions on their movement also limit access to precursors and basic chemical supplies.
Due to travel restrictions, traffickers may have to seek out new routes and methods.
The patterns of drug use and supply may change, potentially hindering the government's ability to respond.
The changes brought about by the COVID-19 pandemic are unprecedented, but there are still valuable lessons and experiences to be learned from past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some drug users started seeking cheaper synthetic substances and shifted their usage pattern towards injecting drugs.
At the same time, governments of various countries have reduced their budgets related to narcotics.

If governments of all countries respond to the current economic downturn in the same manner, prevention measures and harm reduction services aimed at curbing drug use and related risky behaviors, as well as drug treatment services, may suffer severe setbacks.
Furthermore, the priority of interdiction actions and international cooperation may decrease, making traffickers more likely to act.
Some countries have large quantities of drugs smuggled through commercial flights, and these countries' drug trafficking activities are expected to be directly affected the most.

A courier may carry synthesized drugs such as methamphetamine in their personal backpack or hide them in personal luggage, sometimes in large quantities. Since there are restrictions on air cargo almost everywhere, the activity of supplying drugs through commercial air travel may come to a complete halt.
Despite disruptions to the international mail supply chain, illicit activities involving the use of the dark web and mailing of goods may increase.
In the long run, an economic recession and related restrictive measures may disrupt the illicit drug market.

Due to continuously rising unemployment rates and lack of opportunities, impoverished and vulnerable groups are more likely to abuse drugs in harmful ways, contract drug-related illnesses, and turn to illegal activities related to drugs, be it production or transportation.
Drug trafficking organizations may take advantage of this situation by providing services to vulnerable groups and recruiting new members to strengthen their ranks.
As the government's ability to respond decreases, these changes may quickly take root and become the new reality for many communities.
Expansion and Complexity
Market growth
The pattern of population growth partially explains the reason for market expansion.
The phenomenon of drug addiction around the world continues to increase, whether it is measured by the total number or the proportion of drug users in the world's population.

In 2009, it was estimated that there were 210 million drug users, accounting for 4.8% of the global population aged 15-64. By 2018, this number was estimated to have increased to 269 million, accounting for 5.3% of the population in this age group.
In the past twenty years, the growth rate of drug use in developing countries has far outpaced that of developed countries.

To a certain extent, this reflects the difference in overall population growth between this period, with developed countries at 7% and developing countries at 28%, but it also reflects the faster growth of the young population in developing countries.
"Adolescents and young adults make up the largest proportion of drug users."
During the period from 2000 to 2018, the population of developing countries in this age group grew by 16%, while the population of developed countries in this age group decreased by 10%.
Urbanization is a driving force for the current and future drug market.
Regardless of whether it is a developed or developing country, the situation with drug addiction is more prevalent in urban areas than in rural areas.

One of the main reasons for the overall increase in drug use is the large-scale migration of people from rural areas to cities. Currently, more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, while in 1960, this proportion was only 34%.
Urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market, especially in developing countries where urbanization trends are more prominent.

The increase in wealth is correlated with the increase in drug use, but it is primarily the poorest people who bear the greatest burden of disease worldwide, and drug use is more prevalent in developed countries than in developing countries.
Illicit substances like cocaine have a stronger and more secure connection to wealthier regions of the world.
Similarly, within countries, the rate of drug use among the affluent social classes is relatively high.
However, the rate of developing a substance use disorder is higher among individuals with lower socioeconomic status.
Data from a few countries indicates that harmful drug use patterns are associated with low income and certain illnesses.
These patterns appear to be less common in more affluent social layers.
The economic constraints caused by the global COVID-19 pandemic may likely exacerbate the risks faced by marginalized groups, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labor market, such as an increase in the unemployment rate, have historically been linked to an increase in drug use. However, this pandemic has already forced millions of people globally to become unemployed.

The COVID-19 pandemic may lead to further expansion of the drug market. The widespread outbreak of COVID-19 may cause more farmers to increase or engage in the planting of illegal crops, either due to a decrease in the regulatory capabilities of national governing bodies or because, in the face of an economic crisis, more people may be forced to take risks and engage in illegal activities.

The restrictive measures related to COVID-19 have led to a decrease in air and land transportation, but maritime smuggling may have increased as a result. The risk of interception is lower at sea, and the volume of maritime smuggling is likely greater than that of air or land trafficking.
Recently, there have been reports that cocaine goods are being directly shipped from South America to Europe via the sea route.
Complexity increase

The situation of non-internationally controlled substances is stable, but the number of new types of synthetic opioids with potential harm is increasing, making the illicit drug market increasingly complex.

Apart from plant-based substances such as marijuana, cocaine, and heroin, hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added, with many not yet controlled internationally. Non-medical use of drugs is also rapidly increasing.
The domestic market of the member state has around 500 new types of active substances each year.
Currently, the majority of them are stimulants, followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a small amount of opioids.
Although the overall quantity of new types of psychostimulant substances has stabilized, the proportion has changed.
In the new types of psychoactive substances determined in 2014, type opioid (like morphine) psychoactive substances only accounted for 2%, but by 2018, this number had risen to 9%.

In the new type of psychoactive substances similar to opioids, many of them are likened to fentanyl, with their effects and dangers proven, causing overdose deaths in North America, and also in other regions, albeit to a lesser extent.
In North America, fentanyl is used as a cutting agent for heroin and other drugs (including cocaine and methamphetamine), and it is also used to manufacture counterfeit prescription opioids.

Some evidence indicates that there is also a phenomenon of injecting new types of psychoactive substances as stimulants in Europe. A study of residues in abandoned syringes in six European cities found that many syringes were contaminated with newly developed psychoactive substances that produce stimulant effects.
The use of two new types of psychostimulant substances may gradually become entrenched among vulnerable populations.
A single type of new psychoactive substance has rarely formed a large market.
However, evidence from Europe indicates that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among the homeless and prison inmates, who are part of society's marginalized groups.
Twenty-two countries have reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons, with most countries identifying synthetic cannabinoids as the main challenge.

The regulation of precursor chemicals has forced drug manufacturers to innovate, with many of the chemical products commonly used to synthesize phenylpropanolamine, methamphetamine, and "ecstasy," among other illicit drugs, now falling under international control.

Drug traffickers and drug manufacturers are constantly seeking alternatives, including substances with looser regulations and specially designed chemical products intended to evade regulation, also known as "designer precursors."
Restrictive measures aimed at stopping the spread of COVID-19 may further squeeze synthetic drug producers who rely on precursor chemicals.

Evidence from Mexico indicates that this has become a reality: according to reports, a shortage of precursor chemicals for methamphetamine imported from Asia in March 2020 led to a price increase for methamphetamine in Mexico and the United States.
The market is constantly and rapidly changing.
Synthetic drugs are replacing opiates in Central Asia and the Russian Federation.
The opioid market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appears to have changed from 2008 to 2018.
The amount of opioids seized by Russian federal authorities has decreased by approximately 80%, and the number of people receiving treatment for opioid use has significantly decreased.
However, the market for stimulants seems to be becoming increasingly vibrant.
There is evidence that methamphetamine and various types of ketamine, including etorphine and alpha-phenylbutylamine, are now widely available on the Russian drug market.

Russian authorities have reported that the number of secret drug manufacturing facilities discovered recently has dramatically increased, more than doubling in the past two years and reaching 152 processing sites in 2018.
The market for Afghani and Iraqi methamphetamine is growing.
As early as 2012, investigations into personnel at hospitals, prisons, and other institutions had already revealed the importance of methamphetamine in Iraq.
Crystal methamphetamine has become another major cause for concern, alongside fentanyl and carfentanil.
A 2015 study further confirmed that marijuana is harder to obtain than "meth" or "ecstasy," according to drug users.

Recently, Iraqi authorities have discovered several Methamphetamine production facilities, and the drug control agency has expressed concern over the large-scale importation of pseudoephedrine, which is used as a precursor in the production of these substances at the Methamphetamine production sites.
In Afghanistan, the manufacture of amphetamine-type stimulants such as methamphetamine appears to have begun around 2014.
Ever since then, the seizure amount of methamphetamine has consistently been increasing.

However, the amount of drugs seized in the first half of 2019 was 1657 kg, a significant large increase compared to the previous year. (Note: The character "^" in the Chinese source appears to be a typo and has been omitted in the English translation.)
Large quantities of methamphetamine believed to be originating from Afghanistan have been seized in other countries, indicating that production in that country is rapidly increasing.
Policy changes and trends.
The legalization of non-medical marijuana use generally shows an increasing trend in marijuana use.
Canada, Uruguay, and the United States allow the production of cannabis products for non-medical use in 11 of their legal jurisdictions.

In the majority of jurisdictions, marijuana use has increased since its decriminalization, although the same trend has been observed in other jurisdictions that have not yet legalized non-medical use of marijuana.

In the United States, the two states that were the first to legalize recreational marijuana use through legislation, Colorado and Washington, have seen an increase in adult non-medical use of marijuana, particularly in cases of use within the past month or daily/almost daily use, which have exceeded the national average level since 2012.
All indicators show that marijuana use in Uruguay has increased since 2011, with usage in the past month nearly doubling.
The main reason for the increase is due to frequent and regular use of marijuana.
Canadian short-term data also indicates that while the legal market expanded from 2018 to 2019, consumption levels were increasing as well.
However, in 2019, 40% of cannabis users still obtained certain products through illegal sources.
Is the global decline in illicit cannabis seizures due to marijuana legalization?
In 2018, the global cannabis plant seizures reached a lowest level in the past 20 years, which was due to a decrease in seizures in North America, which has dropped by 84% in the past 10 years.

Compared to other regions worldwide, the amount of drug seizures during the same period has nearly doubled. The pattern of seizures indicates that policies aimed at opening up the marijuana market have played a crucial role in their decline.

The regulation of new types of psychotropic substances appears to have a suppressing effect, but it is still difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of the regulation of new types of psychotropic substances within the country.
Some countries with different regulatory systems for new types of psychotropic substances show varying rates of use of new psychotropic substances.
In some countries, the use of new types of psychotropic substances has decreased following domestic legislation.

Vulnerable populations face harm from both legal and illegal opioid markets, primarily provided for pain management and palliative care in high-income countries, with uneven distribution in different regions.
In 2018, more than 90% of all opioid medications available for medical consumption were in high-income countries.
Approximately 50% are in North America, 40% are in Europe, and 2% are in Australasia.
These countries' population accounts for approximately 12% of the global population.
According to estimates, the population of low- and middle-income countries accounts for 88% of the global population, but their consumption of pharmaceutical opioids is less than 10%.
The barriers to obtaining prescription opioids are related to many factors, including legislation, culture, healthcare systems, and prescribing practices.
The risk of developing a drug use disorder is higher for people who are relatively poor and impoverished, with an estimated 35.6 million people suffering from drug use disorders in 2018.

Poverty, limited education, and social marginalization can increase the risk of substance abuse disorders and exacerbate their consequences. Research from high-income countries has confirmed this, showing that an individual's unfavorable socioeconomic trajectory, and not just their status at a given point in time, is related to the risk of substance abuse disorders.

Drug addiction can further exacerbate societal and economic disadvantages, increasing the risks of unemployment, poverty, and homelessness, thereby fueling a vicious cycle of disadvantage. These results may also be related to the derogatory attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system.

Women, ethnic minorities, immigrants, the LGBTQ+ community, individuals displaced by armed conflict or disaster, and rural residents may also be disproportionately affected by substance use disorders or face challenges in accessing treatment services.

According to the disability-adjusted life year (DALY) metric, which estimates the number of healthy life years lost due to disability and premature death, the harmful impact of drug abuse on society has become more severe over the past 10 years.
From 2007 to 2018, the global life expectancy adjustment years due to drug addiction increased by 17%.
The increase in lifespan years for disability adjustments due to liver cancer caused by untreated hepatitis B among injection drug users is especially high, reaching 40%.
The relationship between drugs and violence is complex and it is difficult to determine all causal relationships between the use of psychoactive substances and violence.
Global data, though limited, suggests that intoxication may be an important factor in homicides.
However, in violent incidents, alcohol's role seems to be greater than that of drugs.

Although drug use may lead to criminal behavior, in some cases, this connection can be partially attributed to various intervening factors, such as social-economic disadvantages and other types of adversity resulting from individual risk, family environment, and peer influence.
The connections between drug trafficking and violence are multifaceted.
If there already exists a stable criminal structure, including large-scale organized crime activities such as international drug trafficking, they could potentially be carried out without violence.

In the short term, the existence and degree of violence are not so much determined by the quantity of trafficking, but rather by certain changes that disrupt the balance of power between organized criminal groups, such as changes in the scale of the illegal market, the death or imprisonment of notorious criminals, and law enforcement measures that weaken one group relative to another.
Latest trend(s)
Marijuana is the most commonly used substance, and its harm is comparable to that of opiates.
According to estimates, there were approximately 1.92 billion drug users of marijuana in 2018, making it the most widely used illicit drug globally.
Compared to other years, it is estimated that around 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
However, the related harms of opioid medications are often overlooked due to their less frequent use.

Of the estimated 167,000 deaths related to drug use disorders in 2017, 66% were caused by these substances. Of the 21 million years of life lost due to disability or premature death caused by drug use, 50% were caused by these substances.
The non-medical use of synthetic opioids has exacerbated the public health crisis.

In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, the opioid crisis is exacerbated by ketamine; in North America, it is fentanyl. These two regions have almost no commonalities in terms of economics, demographic statistics, or general drug use patterns, but they are both actively combating the opioid crisis fueled by substances that are easy to obtain and have low production costs.
In North America, the use of synthetic opioids like fentanyl has led to a rise in overdose deaths over the past 20 years.
In 2018, out of the 67,367 registered overdose deaths in the United States, two-thirds involved fentanyl.
Canada also reported similar results, but the numbers were lower.
The overdose deaths caused by fentanyl are partly due to the unpredictable effects of illicit fentanyl in the illegal drug market.
In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, there has been a significant increase in the market for Quinine (curative) for non-medical uses.
In this region, the number of patients with kyphosis who receive treatment is increasingly more.
In 2017, the global seizure of pangolin scales significantly increased, reaching a peak of over 125 tons.
However, in 2018, after India passed a new regulation to crack down on tusk smuggling, the global seizure amount dropped to 32 tons.

The crisis in these two regions was caused by the production of easily synthesized substances with low manufacturing costs, as well as the lack of international regulation of QUINETA and many FENTANYL-like substances or their precursors.

The crisis in these two regions is exacerbated by the fact that these substances are available in both the pharmaceutical market and the black market, making it more difficult to detect and prevent their abuse.
The use of stimulants is increasingly frequent.
In the field of stimulants, cocaine and methamphetamine are the main substances, and the usage volume of both in their main markets is increasing.
Approximately 1.9 million people used cocaine in 2018, as cocaine is popular in North America and Western Europe.
Approximately 27 million people use phenethylamines in the same year, with methylphenidate being the most widely used phenethylamine in Southeast Asia and North America.
Based on the majority of indicators, the use of methamphetamine in these two regions has continued to expand over the past 20 years.

In some markets, cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist, sometimes substituting for each other. In such cases, as the usage of one drug increases, the usage of the other drug decreases, and at other times, both increase and decrease simultaneously to meet the same market's demand.
The risk of injection drug use increases with new coronavirus pneumonia.
According to estimates, approximately 1,130 million people injected drugs in 2018, and it is estimated that around 10% of the global HIV infections are attributed to injecting drug use.
More than 100 million people who inject drugs are infected with the HIV virus, and 550 million people are infected with hepatitis C.
In 2017, an estimated 58.5 million people died from drug abuse, with half of them dying from liver diseases caused by hepatitis B, most of which remain untreated among injection drug users.
The shortage of opioids caused by COVID-19 restrictions may lead users to substitute alcohol or benzodiazepines, which are easier to obtain, or to mix class A opioids with synthetic drugs.
As some users switch to injecting or inject more frequently, there may be an increase in harmful usage methods.

EU summit debates refugee policy, EU officials say reception process is full of bottlenecks - Xinhua Net
EU summit debates migration policy without respite; EU officials: The reception process at every step encounters bottlenecks.

["Global Times Brussels Correspondent Ni Ruifei, according to a February 10 report by AFP: At the most recent EU summit, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen stated that EU leaders have agreed to enact stricter policies regarding illegal immigration, making it easier to expel illegal immigrants."]

According to reports, this move by the EU is in response to the growing concern over illegal immigration in Europe. However, the EU's core issue now is that the number of illegal immigrants who can ultimately be deported is small.

Based on the summit document, European leaders have urged the Commission to "immediately mobilize substantial EU funds" to strengthen the external border with infrastructure and surveillance measures.
However, the European Union and its member countries have been arguing relentlessly over issues such as fence payment costs.
Fen Delei'en repeatedly stated that EU funds will not pay for the relevant costs.

However, diplomatic officials from some member countries have suggested that if the European Union could share in the installation of surveillance cameras, watchtowers, and other basic infrastructure along the external borders, it would free up national budgets for individual countries, thereby accelerating the construction process.

According to the Euractiv website, a EU official admitted that there are bottlenecks in every step of the refugee acceptance process, and the limited reception capacity and overburdened immigration authorities of member states cannot prevent migrants from submitting "countless" asylum applications in various EU countries. The EU's refugee acceptance system is in a state of "nearly permanent crisis."
According to the European Commission, EU member states received over 920,000 asylum applications last year, an increase of nearly half compared to the previous year.
At the same time, the European Union recorded over 330,000 instances of illegal immigration last year.
In this context, the summit reached an agreement on a "principle," namely that EU countries can return illegal immigrants to their home country based on a court decision from another member state.
Furthermore, reports indicate that EU leaders have agreed to "increase the use of the concept of 'like-minded countries,'" which will pave the way for the EU to establish a shared list.

(Source: Global Times, Author: Niurufei)

"US Escalates 'Chip War,' Seriously Damaging Global Semiconductor Industry" - Xinhua Net

Recently, the "chip war" between the United States and China has been escalating, with the Netherlands and Japan agreeing to restrict exports of chip manufacturing equipment to China under US pressure. Later, media reports indicated that the US government is considering cutting off all connections between US suppliers and Huawei, prohibiting US suppliers from providing any products to Huawei. Furthermore, the Biden administration is preparing to issue an administrative order limiting US investment in sensitive Chinese technology industries... Early in 20

In recent years, the United States has not ceased its actions to suppress the development of China's "silicon" industry. On the one hand, it precisely targets pressure on China's semiconductor production and supply chain, and on the other hand, it builds a "decoupling" alliance for the semiconductor industry chain, aiming to completely "shake off" China in the advanced semiconductor industry.

Regardless of whether it is to woo South Korea to establish a "technology alliance," or to establish a semiconductor "quadrilateral alliance" with South Korea, Japan, and Chinese Taiwan, or to build a semiconductor industry chain "small circle" through the "Quad" mechanism or the "Indo-Pacific Economic Framework," the US is attempting to politicize, factionalize, and militarize the semiconductor industry
However, the US's grandiose "tech war" against China is a case of "inflicting 1,000 wounds on the enemy while suffering 800 ones."

Recently, globally recognized chip manufacturing equipment supplier, Lam Research Corporation, has announced that due to the impact of the latest round of export restrictions on chip manufacturing equipment to China, the company plans to lay off 1,300 full-time employees and expects to let go of an additional 1,400 temporary workers in the next two quarters.

Recently, the global semiconductor equipment giant, ASML Holding NV from the Netherlands, has warned of a ban on exporting chip-making equipment to China, which may cause semiconductor prices to rise.

According to American media analysis, many American companies have been significantly impacted by the US government's aggressive suppression of China's chip and semiconductor industries, including developers of electronic design automation tools, chip design firms, manufacturers of semiconductor manufacturing equipment, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The so-called repression of China's advanced semiconductor industry by the United States has dragged down the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain.
The semiconductor industry is a high-technology and knowledge-intensive industry that has long established a tightly integrated global semiconductor industry chain.

According to industry experts, the entire production process for semiconductor products requires crossing national borders more than 70 times, taking up to 100 days in total, based on specialized division of labor.

Although the US semiconductor industry has a strong foundation, its manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced process technology, are relatively weak and heavily reliant on the East Asian region.

Even if the United States vigorously guides the advanced chip production and supply chain to shift toward a "small circle" of regional development dominated by itself, it is difficult to change the regional distribution and mutual dependence of the global semiconductor-related industries.
The US is vigorously "reshaping" and "de-sinicizing" the semiconductor industry chain, inflicting damage on the global semiconductor industry.
The chip is the core of the global future industry, and the development of the chip industry cannot do without the joint participation of countries around the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, including the passage of the "Innovation and Competition Act," the "2022 America COMPETES Act," and the "CHIPS and Science Act," using technological hegemony to consolidate its technological leading advantage; and employing a carrot-and-stick approach to entice semiconductor manufacturing companies such as Intel, TSMC, and Samsung to establish factories in
In the short term, the US has indeed caused trouble for China's chip industry and related industries, reaping tangible benefits.

However, in the long run, the US's hysterical repression and coercion of China's chip industry will only force China's industry to continually break through, causing the US to lose a massive Chinese market. Ultimately, this will significantly weaken American technology companies' innovation desire and ability, and harm global chip industry development.

The first batch of personal annuity financial products go on sale, with the shortest holding period being 360 days - China News Network
The first batch of personal pension financial products go on sale.
A family institution offers 7 selectable products, with the shortest holding period being 360 days.
Personal pension financial products have finally gone live.

On February 10, China Finance Online released the first batch of personal retirement financial product list, with 7 personal retirement financial products from Postal Savings Bank of China, Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, and Agricultural Bank of China officially on sale.

"Thus, the 'shelf' for personal retirement accounts has finally assembled personal retirement savings, personal retirement financial management, personal retirement insurance, and personal retirement public funds, totaling four types of products."

According to the introduction, the first batch of personal pension financial products are all publicly offered open-ended funds, consisting of 5 newly issued products and 2 ongoing products. Among them, one product is a mixed-type product, while the remaining 6 products are all fixed-income type products.

A reporter from Beijing Youth Daily observed that out of the 5 new products launched, 4 are from ICBC Wealth Management, all of which are fixed-income products. The shortest holding periods are 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days, with corresponding performance benchmarks (annualized) of 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.10% -

The remaining new product on sale is "E-bank Wealth Prolonged Luxury · Grand Hong Jin No. 1," which is a fixed-income product, with a collection period from February 10 to February 19. The risk level is grade two.

One of the continuing products is the "Agricultural Bank of China's Agricultural Bank Union·Dynamic" 360-day technological innovation RMB financial product, with an investment nature of mixed and a risk level of three.

Another ongoing product is "China Postal Savings Wealth Add-health Hong Jin Shortest Holding 1#", a fixed-income type, which started fundraising on December 30, 2020, and officially operated on January 4, 2021, with a cumulative net value of 1.0011 as of February 8, 2021.

According to the "Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Promoting the Development of Personal Pension", financial products that personal pension funds can be invested in include bank wealth management products, savings deposits, commercial annuity insurance, and publicly offered funds.

The first batch of personal retirement financial products has been released, marking the official launch of individual retirement investors' ability to purchase financial products through their personal retirement fund accounts.
Last November, the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission formulated the "Interim Measures for the Management of Personal Pension Business for Commercial Banks and Trust Companies."

The method stipulates that individuals can purchase various personal retirement products, including personal retirement savings, personal retirement financial products, personal retirement insurance products, and personal retirement public fund products, using their personal retirement funds account.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the State Administration of Taxation issued a notice, clarifying that the personal pension system will be launched in 36 pilot cities and regions, including Beijing, Tianjin, Shijiazhuang in Hebei province, Xiongan New Area, Jincheng in Shanxi province.
As of the end of 2022, the number of personal pension plan participants was 19.54 million, with 6.13 million contributors and a total contribution amount of 14.2 billion yuan.
Previously, banks participating in the pilot had only listed personal retirement savings, personal retirement insurance products, and personal retirement public funds as three categories of products.
Now that personal retirement investment products have also gathered together, how should investors choose?

A Jianyin Finance Product Development Department expert states that compared to other personal retirement products, retirement financial products in the pilot phase and personal retirement financial products both have three characteristics in common.
The first is stability, with enhanced risk management mechanisms, more stable investment strategies and principles, and the implementation of non-bank third-party independent custody.

Secondly, in terms of long-term planning, the term limit for all current trial-stage retirement financial products is 5 years or more. In the future, the minimum holding period for personal retirement financial products that will be issued is principally 1 year, with a strong encouragement to hold for 3 years or more.

The third characteristic is affordability, with low purchase thresholds for products, typically starting at 1 RMB and sometimes as low as 0.01 RMB, and with even more favorable rates for custody fees, management fees, and other charges.
Professional experts suggest that investors should choose products based on their features and their own risk tolerance.

Personal retirement savings accounts have the characteristics of a longer term, higher interest rates, and high safety, making them suitable for low-risk tolerance groups. Personal retirement insurance products focus on protection and are more suitable for those who cannot afford to take on investment risks and can accept stable returns. However, personal retirement financial products and publicly offered fund products do not guarantee the principal or returns, and have certain investment risks, but are suitable for individuals with certain financial knowledge and a higher risk tolerance.
Article/Nanfang Daily Reporter Cheng Jie coordinated/Chi Haibo
The fitness industry needs to overcome the trust crisis - China News Service
Another large gym "blows up"?
Recently, the member rights protection issue at the well-known fitness center Zhong Jian Health has attracted societal attention.

After the Chinese New Year, many members discovered that their designated stores were not operating normally, leading to rumors of the institution's closure and causing panic among members. This resulted in intervention from the public security and social affairs departments.
Finally, a representative of the institution responded, pledging to strive to ensure the legitimate rights of employees and members, and the storm was eventually calmed down.

Certain fitness institutions' branches have encountered operational issues and have temporarily closed. While consumers could calmly and patiently wait for the problems to be resolved, why do many members' first reactions tend to be "something serious is happening"?
Behind the fitness club member rights storm, there lies a deep-seated trust crisis within the industry.
Domestic traditional gyms generally adopt a prepaid model, with "earning money from users who don't come" being the underlying logic of their development.

Obtaining cash flow through advance membership cards and continuously opening new stores may seem like a self-sustaining cycle, but in reality, it is like eating tomorrow's food today, unable to form a sustainable profit model.
Negative information about fitness centers and other industries frequently emerges, causing a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the market outlook, fitness centers can certainly be considered a profitable business.
Although the fitness industry is volatile, it has consistently received capital attention.
Multiple data show that the popularity of cultural and sports consumption in various fields is continuously increasing, and the market continues to warm up.

Specifically in the fitness industry, as the standard of living of residents continues to gradually improve and the concept of a healthy lifestyle deeply permeates, there is great potential for the development of the fitness industry.
The better the situation gets, the more the industry needs to focus on the quality of development.

However, certain institutions are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the consumption recovery, having just emerged from the crisis, and recklessly blow the horn to expand and open up new stores, pouring all their financing into the construction of new outlets.

It cannot be denied that in recent years, many institutions have withdrawn due to the impact of the epidemic, and the industry has been reshuffled. It is not that powerful companies choosing to increase their acquisition efforts and reposition themselves now is not a new opportunity.
However, for the fitness market to develop in a healthy and sustainable way and pave the way for long-term success, the industry must change its traditional models and strategies.
Only by being steady and consistent, and rebuilding consumers' trust and sense of security, can we truly win the market and secure the future.
Compared to aggressively opening new stores to seize the market, the fitness industry currently needs to focus on optimizing service and securing users through high-quality development.
First, you must retain users through service.
The gym is part of the service industry, and its essence lies in being user-oriented. It must tightly focus on user needs and place the emphasis on improving and upgrading service quality.
Secondly, digital transformation is key to improving user experience.
For example, the popular internet gym model, which allows users to pay per visit and choose their own facilities.
At the same time, physical data and sports data can be effectively utilized and can also meet social needs, thus realizing a complete service loop from online to offline.
Users' worry about fitness centers "running away" decreases without private coaching sales and expensive annual memberships, and their trust is also increased.
Additionally, we should actively explore diverse business models.

Now, sports consumption has evolved from single service to scene consumption. Fitness clubs have the potential to become a new entry point for consumption. Products surrounding sports supplements and fitness equipment, etc., may become new profit points, providing consumers with more diverse choices.

"The fear now is that after making the purchase, the price will drop, and going to the sales office to argue won't be feasible due to a lack of time. Even if one doesn't argue, it's still
Moreover, many homebuyers believe that "fixed-price agreements" may provide them with some peace of mind, but the conditions are not lenient.

However, such properties are few and far between, making the "barrier" to purchase still quite high.

Some homebuyers believe that due to asymmetric information, it is not uncommon for sellers to offer additional concessions during the sale, but the difficulty for buyers to assert their rights is not small.
Whether it is possible to retain homebuyers remains to be seen.

However, more than two months have passed, and according to the online real estate data, the total unsold units of this building project is currently 157 units, accounting for 62.3%, among which Building 8 has a total of 128 units, with 113 unsold units, and Building 7 has 124 units, with 44 unsold units. The total sales volume of the project is only 33 units,
"Market participants mentioned that 'fixed price agreements' had also appeared in Nanjing in 2008."

In August of that year, to attract potential homebuyers to the Hengtang Xiyuan property development on the west bank of the river in Hexi, the company introduced a "Price Protection Plan," which stated, "The company solemnly promises that if the discount on the project is expanded within one year, any resulting difference will be refunded to existing homeowners according to the amount of the difference."
Since April 2011, nine residential developments in Nanjing have offered "difference compensation" for certain properties.
"The property market is warming up, and it is even more necessary to have a 'shot of adrenaline' at this time."
"Mr. Chen, a seasoned player in the Nanjing real estate industry, stated that 'fixed-price agreements' are also a marketing method used by property developers."
He believes that, at present, developers require confidence more than homebuyers, and the introduction of a "fixed-price agreement" is essentially a way to boost their morale.

As for whether it is possible to retain homebuyers, he stated that it depends on the impact of multiple factors including regulatory policies and loan thresholds, and remains to be seen at the moment.
Multiple Data Show Retreat, Taiwan's Economy Performs Poorly at the Beginning of the Year - Xinhua Net

Xinhua News Agency, Taipei, February 11: The export trade volume has seen five consecutive months of decline, the manufacturing Purchasing Manager's Index (PMI) has contracted for seven consecutive months, and the Consumer Price Index (CPI) has seen a "three-digit" increase again... Recently, the Taiwan authorities have released the economic data for January 2023.
Experts analyze that Taiwan's economic performance at the beginning of the year is less than ideal, and growth pressures are not small.

According to the financial authorities of the Taiwanese government, Taiwan's exports in January this year were US$315.1 billion, a year-on-year decrease of 21.2%, marking the fifth consecutive month of negative growth.
The export value of the 11 major export categories has decreased compared to the same period last year.
The drop in the price of synthetic rubber and its products, as well as optical instruments, was the most significant, with decreases of 37.6% and 35.7% respectively.
Electronic component exports decreased by 20.1%, marking the largest reduction in the past 11 years.
Among them, integrated circuits fell by 18.3%, marking the largest drop in 14 years.

The head of the statistics department, Cai Meina, stated that this shows the demand for the consumer electronics industry is weakening and spreading, indicating that the electronics industry has entered a correction period.
According to statistics, Taiwan's imports and exports both dropped in January, with the total value of outbound shipments reaching only 23.4 billion US dollars, marking a three-year low.

The financial authorities in charge of Taiwan's affairs believe that global demand for terminals has decreased, and industry adjustment and inventory reduction have suppressed manufacturers' purchasing intentions. The weak export trend is unlikely to improve in the short term, and Taiwan's first-quarter exports this year are feared to decline more than expected.

According to the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, after seasonal adjustment, Taiwan's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) for January 2023 was 40.4%, down 3.3 percentage points from December last year, marking the seventh consecutive month of contraction.

In the economic monitoring indicator system, the PMI (Purchasing Manager's Index) uses 50% as the demarcation line between prosperity and recession. A reading greater than 50% indicates economic expansion, while a reading below 50% suggests contraction.
In January, five components of the Taiwan PMI indicated that new orders and production were contracting, while employment and supplier delivery times were decreasing, and inventory was tight.

The six major industries have all reported a contraction in their PMI (Purchasing Manager's Index); they are ranked by the degree of contraction as follows: power and machinery manufacturing (35.1%), electronic and optical manufacturing (35.2%), chemical and biotech/medical manufacturing (39.2%), basic raw material manufacturing (42.4%), transportation equipment manufacturing (42.6%), and food and textile manufacturing

In terms of prices, Taiwan's "Directorate-General of Budget, Accounting and Statistics" announced that the CPI year-on-year inflation rate for January 2023 was 3.04%, marking the second time since July last year that it has exceeded 3%.
Vegetable prices soared 28.25% and reached a 17-month high.

"The head of the 'State Council's Development Research Center' (CAO Zhihong) admitted that the increase in vegetable prices has exceeded expectations, and excluding the impact of the Chinese New Year, the CPI for January and February combined is expected to be around 2.71%, which is the same as the previous month's figure. Inflationary pressure still exists and remains high."
Looking ahead at the Taiwanese economy this year, according to reports from The United Daily News and Yahoo Finance, among other local media outlets, experts have expressed a pessimistic outlook.

Professor Wu Datong from the Economics Department of "Central University" in Taiwan analyzed that a decline in exports may cause cash flow problems for export manufacturing companies and increase the risk of debt defaults.
At the same time, a decrease in orders has led manufacturers to reduce their workforce, affecting the labor market and household economies, which in turn undermines consumption capacity.

According to Research Fellow Kuo Tzung-yu of the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, the inflation situation in Europe and America remains unresolved, and demand continues to shrink. He expects Taiwan's export decline to persist into the first half of the year.
Due to Taiwan's economy relying on exports, with the impact of declining exports, the annual economic growth performance will not be as good as last year.

Henan Province Standardizes and Integrates Oral Implant Medical Service Prices - China News Network
CCTV News: A dental implant is an ideal choice for many tooth loss patients, but the price, which often runs tens of thousands of yuan per tooth, has deterred many from pursuing this option.
This year, with the accelerated implementation of centralized dental implant procurement, many regions have also put dental implant price reductions on the agenda.

Starting from February 10, the target price for the full process of regular implantation of a single tooth medical service in Henan Province is 4300 yuan, and the full process fee for a single regular implant should not exceed 97% of the target price.
Dental implant refers to a method of dental restoration that supports and stabilizes the upper dental prosthesis through the implantation of a lower structure in the bone tissue.

Journalists learned from the First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University that, as an example, the cost for a single regular transplant, from planting to final repair, is approximately 16,700 yuan.
Patient He Ying: After the new policy, the doctor told me that a case like mine would be around 8,000 to 10,000 yuan, and it can be saved by half.

Based on the current project, Henan Province has integrated and determined 15 dental implant-related medical service price items, including the "planting implant fee (per piece)," and has unified the pricing and medical insurance payment categories for public medical institutions at the provincial level. Meanwhile, 20 medical service price items, including dental implant surgery, have been canceled or adjusted.

Xinhua News Agency reported on February 11 that with the emergence of a "new variable" in China's e-commerce industry, how can livestreaming e-commerce make "content king"?

A reporter from China News Service, Xia Bin.

Note: In Chinese, the surname usually comes before the given name, so "Xia Bin" is the correct order for this person's name.
We entered the e-commerce industry relatively late, but from the very beginning, we were aware that in order to stand out among the millions of stores, content is crucial.
"Floral, a '90s girl from Guangdong, is now running an e-commerce store for a nourishing food materials shop on Douyin, helping a business with over 30 years of offline history to 'bloom' online."
Imitating the atmosphere of old Hong Kong films and accompanied by classic Cantonese songs, the exquisite videos on the @FangFang1PersonEat TikTok account offer a fresh audiovisual experience.

At a recent Douyin e-commerce event titled "Seeking Companions · Quality Content Sharing Session," Fangfang, as a representative of quality creators, attended and spoke about her daily creation experiences and insights.

She said on the scene, "The carefully polished video has gained the attention of many netizens, and many people are interested in the ingredients in my home and want to cook together. The sales route has opened up all of a sudden."

Flora leveraged her cooking videos featuring "Grandpa Guang's flavor" to make more people fall in love with it, and a single live stream sold up to 300,000 units of nourishing ingredients, saving her family's brink-of-bankruptcy store.
"No content, not e-commerce," as short videos and live e-commerce continue to develop, people's requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early stages of livestreaming e-commerce, livestreaming rooms often attracted users with low prices and discounts, with price advantage being the only selling point at the time.

In recent years, in addition to celebrity-level influencers like Liu Yanhao and Dongfang Zixuan, there have also emerged many lesser-known experts and merchants who specialize in niche fields. By consistently creating high-quality content that aligns with their brand personality, they have been able to enhance their long-term operational benefits.

Introducing Gaoya Xuan, the operations manager for Douyin e-commerce influencers, who revealed that over the past year, 62.7 million creators have monetized their content through Douyin e-commerce, with a 252% increase in their content creation volume and total transaction volume more than doubling.
"Behind these numbers, we can feel a thriving ecosystem of authors, full of vitality."
"Gao Yaoxuan said," or "According to Gao Yaoxuan," depending on the context.

Previously, the Beijing Normal University's Platform for Innovation and Experimentation in Communication and Future Media released the "Electronic Commerce Content Ecosystem Health Index (ECHI) Report," which analyzed the importance of high-quality content, a "new variable" in the e-commerce industry, from a data perspective. The report evaluated the content ecosystem situation of 27 mainstream domestic e-commerce platforms using the index.
According to the e-commerce industry health index ranking in the aforementioned report, Douyin E-commerce, Kuaishou, Taobao, Pinduoduo, and JD rank in the top five.

The report considers the e-commerce content ecosystem to be a comprehensive concept that integrates e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce. High-quality PGC (professionally produced content) and UGC (user-generated content) are the ideal carriers for integration with e-commerce. The higher the value of the content platform, the richer the consumption and promotion scenarios, and the higher the possibility of e-commerce embedding, resulting in stronger

At the scene, Professor Yirmu Kim, Dean of the School of Journalism and Communication at Beijing Normal University and Chairman of the Committee of China Media Economic and Management Major, analyzed and interpreted the "Report."

He stated that, in terms of content value, the current e-commerce industry has transitioned from a stage of "accessibility of consumption" to a stage of "improvement of consumption quality." High-quality, professional, and specialized content is the "hard currency" of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the fundamental basis and handle for the development of e-commerce into a new stage, and knowledge payment, professional knowledge, and KOL (Key Opinion Leaders) have become standard features in e-commerce live streaming.
Looking forward to the future development of the e-commerce industry, Guo Mingyu offers two suggestions.

Promoting the health and quality of the e-commerce content ecosystem from a structural perspective, constructing positive content creation and management standards, and achieving a balanced dynamic and health system index in the e-commerce industry's content ecosystem.
Another aspect is to achieve a healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and value co-creation with the external environment from the perspective of its external ecology.

The future e-commerce industry will require further support in terms of data and artificial intelligence to form stable development predictions. Additionally, it should provide a more standardized and healthy growth space for merchants, achieving value co-creation between companies, users, products, and services, and collectively creating a healthy content ecology in the e-commerce industry.

The first batch of 56 stocks subject to securities lending and borrowing will be determined using January 31, 2023 as the calculation benchmark date.

The Northern Stock Exchange has stated that the list of stocks for securities financing and securities that can be used as collateral for margin trading will be made available through the "Disclosure Information-Financing and Margin Trading Information" column on the Northern Stock Exchange's official website, for the convenience of investors.
Securities financing and securities lending are important fundamental institutions in the securities market, and are also a mature trading method in international securities markets.
On September 2, 2021, during the announcement of its first anniversary, the Beijing Stock Exchange solicited public opinions on its securities financing and margin trading business.

The launch of financing and securities lending business at the Beijing Equity Exchange is an important measure to continuously promote the institutional building of the Beijing Equity Exchange, perfect its trading mechanisms, and enhance the pricing function of the secondary market.

The financing and securities lending system is beneficial for enriching investment strategies, meeting diverse trading needs of investors, promoting price discovery in the market, and further enhancing market liquidity.

The next step, Beijing Equity Exchange will continue to carry out various safeguard work for the securities financing business under the leadership of the China Securities Regulatory Commission, focusing on investor demand to enrich trading system tools and improve related supporting mechanisms. Our goal is to build a first-class exchange that serves innovative small and medium-sized enterprises.
The 16th China-Japan Energy Conservation and Environmental Protection Forum was held in Beijing. He Liangfang attended the main forum and delivered a keynote speech - Xinhua Net.

Xinhua News Agency, Beijing, February 11: The Sixteenth China-Japan Energy Conservation and Environmental Protection Comprehensive Forum was held in Beijing on February 11 through a combination of online and offline methods.

Comrade He Lifeng, a member of the Political Bureau of the Communist Party of China Central Committee and head of the National Development and Reform Commission, attended the Symposium and delivered a keynote speech.

He Lifeng stated that holding this forum is an important measure for implementing the consensus reached by President Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Fumio Kishida at their meeting in Bangkok, and for strengthening Sino-Japanese cooperation on green development.

China will fully implement and carry out the spirit of the 20th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, accelerate the transformation towards a green development model, deepen the prevention and control of environmental pollution, comprehensively strengthen resource conservation, actively and steadily promote the peak and neutralization of carbon, and jointly promote carbon reduction, pollution reduction, afforestation, and development. Promote ecological priority, thrift, and green and low-carbon development.

China is willing to make joint efforts with Japan to continue deepening cooperation in the green and low-carbon industry, technology, policy dialogue, and cultural exchange, and promote the continuous advancement of Sino-Japanese green development cooperation to a new level.
Japanese Economy and Industry Minister Kajiyama Hiroshi Attends the Keynote Forum and Delivers a Speech on the Main Theme.

The forum is jointly hosted by the National Development and Reform Commission of China, the Ministry of Commerce of China, the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry of Japan, and the Japan-China Economic Association, and includes the main forum and four sub-forums on energy efficiency improvement, automobile electrification and intelligence, hydrogen energy, and Sino-Japanese long-term trade.
Representatives from the governments, companies, and organizations of China and Japan held exchanges.
Chinese rescue team continues relief efforts in Turkey, rescues 4 trapped individuals - Xinhua Net

According to a message on the website of the Emergency Management Department on February 11, on February 10, three action teams and 45 rescue personnel from the Chinese rescue team rescued one trapped person in Turkey.
Simultaneously dispatch two search assessment teams to conduct an assessment and investigation of Building 15 on Vladivostok Street.
As of now, a total of 4 trapped individuals have been rescued, and 5 deceased have been discovered. A life-sign and risk assessment is being conducted on 25 severely collapsed buildings.
The rescue team will adjust the rescue force scientifically based on the actual situation in the disaster area and the current rescue scene, and continuously deepen the rescue work.

The rescue team obtains rescue appeal information through multiple channels, such as consulates, local governments, and UN rescue organizations, and verifies each piece of information through online inquiries and on-site searches.
Introducing the current rescue situation and building collapse to the Hong Kong Rescue Team of China, and conducting a joint search-and-rescue operation.

Currently, the SSC5 team is jointly responsible for regional coordination with the Italian rescue team, and has dispatched three team members to participate in the coordination work at the 5th region rescue center. They have communicated with rescue teams from Italy, the UK, Serbia, Slovakia, Oman, and other countries, and have learned about the relief efforts of the United Nations relief organization and various national rescue teams.

The rescue team continues to strengthen safety management and team support, adhering to the "unified command, safety first" principle, strengthening safety control at the rescue site, enhancing discipline requirements for rescue work, and clarifying safety precautions.
Maintain the shift-based standby and sentry duty system to strengthen camp security management.

The medical staff of the rescue team provide daily check-ups for the team members, strengthen medical support for key personnel, and currently, all members of the rescue team are in good health, carrying out disinfection in the camp.

After establishing our self-reliant base, our logistics support team constructed 26 wilderness tent structures, consisting of 4 major categories: command and communication, equipment storage, medical and sanitation, and living and lodging, as well as kennels, ensuring the availability of over 30 sets of rescue equipment on site.

(German news agency - Chinese website) The Biden administration will add six Chinese entities suspected of involvement in the spy balloon program to the blacklist on Friday (February 10).

The U.S. Department of Commerce stated that these 5 Chinese companies and 1 research institution have assisted the Chinese military in modernization, particularly in aerospace projects, including airships and aircraft.
Companies placed on the blacklist find it difficult to obtain US technology exports.

The list, known as the "Entity List," means that companies included on it will not be able to purchase technology or goods from US suppliers unless they obtain a special export license from the US Department of Commerce.

The companies listed on the blacklist are: Beijing Nanjing Kongtian Technology Co., Ltd., China Electronics Technology Group Corporation's 48th Research Institute, Dongguan Lingkong Remote Sensing Technology Co., Ltd., Yingmen Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Yingmen Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd.
Before this, the White House expressed consideration for taking more extensive measures to "expose and address" larger-scale monitoring activities that threaten American national security in China.
The balloon incident has led to further tension between China and the US, with US Secretary of State Blinken canceling his trip to China.

On February 4, the US shot down a balloon, and the Chinese government lodged a serious protest with the US Embassy in China, criticizing the US for severely undermining and harming the efforts and progress of stabilizing US-China relations.

Based on the evidence from the wreckage and information from China's military procurement platforms, the US government has concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon "has a direct relationship with the Chinese Liberation Army" and is an approved supplier of the Chinese military.

Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Mao Ning stated at the press conference on Friday that regarding the accident in which a Chinese unmanned aerial vehicle mistakenly entered American airspace due to force majeure, China has repeatedly explained the situation and clarified its position.
According to the foreign ministry's website, she further stated that the relevant resolutions of the US Congress are purely political manipulation and hype.
The Chinese side strongly expresses its dissatisfaction and resolutely opposes it.

Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Export Enforcement at the US Department of Commerce, Matthew Axelrod, stated: "Today's action demonstrates our joint effort in detecting and stopping China's use of spy balloons, which have violated the airspace of the United States and over 40 other countries."
Thank you!
Reuters reported that an employee of Guangzhou Thai Sky Airtech Co., Ltd. stated that they were not aware of the sanctions and declined to comment further.
The Chinese embassy in the United States has not yet commented on this information.
(Reuters and others)
Any improper conduct will result in compensation and may also be subject to criminal prosecution.

(Germany's Voice Chinese Network) Several days have passed since the earthquake in parts of Turkey and Syria, and the hope of finding survivors is growing increasingly dim; however, the rescue of a family of five on Saturday brought immense joy to the rescue workers.
According to the Associated Press, a family of five who were trapped in the disaster zone of Nurdaiji Town in Gansu's Jiuquan city for over five days have been successfully rescued.
The rescue team first pulled the mother and daughter out from a pile of ruins, then found the father, but he insisted on rescuing his own son and another daughter first.
After they were all rescued, cheers rang out in the crowd.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaraş, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old woman were successfully rescued despite the harsh cold weather conditions.
"What day is today?"
"The teenager who had been trapped beneath the ruins for 129 hours asked the rescue worker who saved him."
A Kurdish man hugged his cat, which he had just rescued.
Miraculous success rescue cases have brought a glimmer of hope to the once seemingly hopeless search efforts, but at the same time, the number of fatalities continues to rise.
According to official statistics, the earthquake on Monday has already caused over 20,000 deaths in Turkey, with the estimated death toll in neighboring Syria exceeding 3,500 people.
Although experts state that people can survive for more than a week after being trapped in a ruins, the hope of finding more survivors is becoming increasingly slim.
Rescue workers are still using thermal imaging equipment to search for signs of life under the rubble.
At the same time, the focus of the rescue work began to shift towards helping those survivors in critical need of assistance.
UN official: "A disaster 'not seen in a century' has hit this region."

UN Deputy Secretary-General and Emergency Relief Coordinator Martin Griffiths, who oversees humanitarian affairs, stated at a press conference in Turkey that this earthquake is the "worst disaster in the region in a century."
He also praised Turkey's response actions after the disaster as "exceptional."
He also told Reuters reporters that he hopes to provide relief to areas controlled by both the Syrian government and the opposition, but also expressed that "the relevant matters are still unclear."
The United Nations has pledged to provide an additional $25 million in emergency relief funding to civilians in Syrian earthquake-stricken areas.
Earlier this week, the United Nations already announced a allocation of 25 million USD for disaster relief in Turkey and Syria.

The Great Chilean Earthquake (1960)
On May 22, 1960, at 3:11 PM local time, the largest earthquake ever recorded in human history, with a magnitude of 9.5 on the Richter scale, occurred in Valdivia, Chile.
In just ten minutes, the entire city of Vladivostok was reduced to ruins.
A massive tsunami, triggered by the earthquake, struck the Chilean coastline, with waves reaching a height of 25 meters.
The tsunami waves reached as far as Japan and the Philippines.
The exact number of casualties and economic losses caused by a disaster of this scale cannot be known.

The most destructive earthquakes that have occurred globally in the past 60 years were:

The Alaska Earthquake (1964)

March 27, 1964, was a Friday, also known as Good Friday.

(Note: Good Friday is the religious holiday observed by Christians to commemorate the crucifixion of Jesus Christ, which is believed to have taken place on a Friday.)
On this day, the largest earthquake in North American history, with a magnitude of 9.2, occurred in Alaska, USA.
Until 2006, the Alaska earthquake was still the third largest earthquake on record in the world.
An earthquake occurred when a fault between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate ruptured near the College Fjord in Prince William Sound.
The earthquake lasted for 3 to 5 minutes in most areas.
The seabed displacement triggered a massive tsunami with a height of 67 meters.
Because it was a holiday, the school and many businesses were closed.
This earthquake ultimately resulted in 139 people dead.
Among them, 9 people died directly due to the earthquake, while another 130 people died due to the tsunami triggered by the earthquake.

Tangshan Earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two earthquakes of magnitude 7 or above occurred in Hebei Province, Tangshan City, and Fengrun County within a 16-hour period.

The epicenter is 23 kilometers away from the ground.

(Note: In this context, "震源" (zhèn yuán) refers to the epicenter of an earthquake, and "距地面" (jù dì miàn) means "away from the ground." The entire sentence is describing the distance between the epicenter and the ground.)
Tangshan city's traffic, communication, water, and electricity were all interrupted, reduced to flat ground in a moment.
Even 140 kilometers away, the capital Beijing also experienced strong tremors.
According to official statistics, a total of 242,769 people were killed and 164,851 people were severely injured in all disaster-stricken areas, including Beijing and Tianjin, due to the earthquake.
The Tangshan earthquake became the second deadliest earthquake in China's recorded history, with only the 1556 Jiajing earthquake having a higher death toll.
However, overseas scientists estimate that this earthquake may have caused at least 650,000 deaths.

Indian Ocean Earthquake (2004)
On December 26, 2004, an earthquake occurred off the western coast of Aceh Province, Sumatra Island, Indonesia, with a focal depth of 30 kilometers and a magnitude of 9.1 to 9.3.
The earthquake triggered a huge tsunami with wave heights ranging from 15 to 30 meters.

The Pacific coast is affected by 14 countries in total, with the most severely affected regions being Aceh province in Indonesia, the resort areas of Phuket and Hua Hin in Thailand, Sri Lanka, and the Indian state of Tamil Nadu.

At the time, it was the peak tourist season for the Christmas holiday, and a large number of travelers and local residents had gathered in the disaster-stricken area. As a result, many tourists enjoying their holiday on the beach and local people working on the shore were swept into the sea by the tsunami, causing numerous people to become missing in this earthquake.
It is estimated that the number of fatalities and missing persons is at least 300,000.

Wenchuan Earthquake (2008)

Note: The Wenchuan Earthquake, also known as the Great Sichuan Earthquake, occurred on May 12, 2008, in Wenchuan County, Sichuan Province, China, causing widespread destruction and loss of life.
On May 12, 2008, a major earthquake occurred in Wenchuan County, Sichuan Province, China.

According to the China Earthquake Administration, the focal mechanism intensity of this earthquake reached 8.2 degrees, and the maximum intensity reached 8.3 degrees, affecting an area of over 100,000 square kilometers.

As of September 25, 2008, earthquakes had resulted in 69,227 people killed, 17,923 people missing, 374,643 people injured to varying degrees, 19.93 million people losing their homes, and a total of 46.26 million affected population.
It is the most destructive earthquake in the history of the People's Republic of China since its establishment, as well as the deadliest one following the Tangshan earthquake.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12th of each year would be designated as Disaster Prevention and Mitigation Day, strengthening education to the public and attention to disaster prevention and mitigation work.
Subsequently, governments and middle and primary schools in many regions of China hold earthquake drills every year on this day.
Elementary and middle schools also begin to emphasize the popularization of "disaster prevention and reduction" education.

Haiti Earthquake (2010)
On January 12, 2010, an earthquake with a magnitude of 7.0 on the Richter scale occurred in Haiti, an island country in the Caribbean Sea.
The epicenter is located about 25 kilometers southwest of Port-au-Prince, the capital of Haiti, and the depth of the earthquake source is approximately 13 kilometers below the surface.
The International Red Cross estimates that the population affected by the earthquake is approximately 30 million.
The Haitian government has announced that the confirmed death toll has exceeded 200,000.
In some regions of Haiti, up to 90% of buildings were destroyed in the earthquake.
Although the international community has provided extensive aid and support, this overpopulated and corruption-rampant impoverished country has never recovered from this disaster.

The Great East Japan Earthquake (2011)
On March 11, 2011, a large-scale undersea earthquake with a magnitude of 9.0 occurred in the offshore area of northeastern Japan.

The epicenter of the earthquake is located in the Pacific Ocean, to the east of Sendai City, the capital of Miyagi Prefecture, with a determined source depth of 24 kilometers, and it triggered a massive tsunami with a maximum height of 40.1 meters.
This earthquake is the first earthquake with a magnitude exceeding 9 that has been observed in Japan since records began.
Approximately 22,000 people lost their lives in the disaster, and about 400,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant, affected by the earthquake and tsunami, suffered a leak accident.
This accident has been classified as a level 7 event on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
The Fukushima nuclear accident resulted in trace amounts of radioactive substances being detected worldwide, including Iodine-131 and Cesium-137 (with a half-life of 30 years).
Large amounts of radioactive isotopes were therefore released into the Pacific Ocean due to the nuclear accident.
According to UN statistics, at least 8.7 million people urgently need food in the disaster zones of Syria and Iraq.
Just in Syria, a staggering 5.3 million people have lost their homes due to earthquakes.
The World Food Programme (WFP) is urging a $770 million funding appeal to provide food assistance to displaced people in Turkey and Syria affected by the earthquake.
Currently, the temperature in the disaster-stricken area has dropped to below zero, leaving many disaster victims without shelter.
The Turkish government has distributed large quantities of hot meals, tents, and blankets, but these supplies are still hard to reach many people in need of assistance.
And in Syria, which has been mired in a civil war for over 12 years, the earthquake has only added to the misery of the people.
Within four days of the earthquake, the World Food Programme had provided food assistance to 11.5 thousand people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for trauma treatment and emergency surgery.

NEWS GOV-MO: Police Department Warning: Citizens are urged to be wary of fraudulent text messages from fake telecommunications companies.

Recently, the police department has received multiple reports of telecommunications fraud. Criminals have been posing as the local Australian telecommunications company and sending text messages to victims with a link to a fake website. The message claims that the victim's points are about to expire and urges them to quickly exchange them for rewards, thus luring the victim into logging into the fake website to make the exchange.

The cardholder entered their credit card information and verification code as instructed, only to soon receive a notification from their financial institution about suspicious unauthorized charges, suspecting that their credit card data was stolen by the aforementioned website.
Upon investigation, it has been confirmed that the relevant telecommunications company did not send the aforementioned text message.

The police department is urging citizens to stay vigilant if they receive similar mobile text messages, and advised not to click on the website links provided or give out any personal information. If requested to provide credit card information, account transaction passwords, or transaction verification codes, they should be especially cautious to prevent credit card information from being stolen.
Fraud Alert:
Pay more attention to news about network security to increase your personal awareness of protection.
Do not casually log in to websites of unknown origin and register personal and credit card information to prevent theft.
Beware of fake and phishing websites; always make sure that the website address perfectly matches the official website.
Install antivirus software on your phones, mobile devices, or computers, and update it regularly.
If you suspect you have encountered scamming or other criminal activity, immediately call the fraud complaint inquiry hotline 880
