Xi Jinping Writes Back to Encourage and Praise the Chinese Medical Team in Africa: Use Benevolent Hearts and Skills to Benefit the Local People and Tell the Good Story of China with Practical Actions - Scroll News - Hunan Daily Network - Hua Sheng Online

"Xi Jinping writes back to encourage and praise the Chinese medical team assisting Africa: Use a benevolent heart and benevolent skills to benefit the local people, and tell the Chinese story with concrete actions."
(Source: Xinhua News Agency) (Editor: Li Xufeng) Font size: [large | medium | small]

Xinhua News Agency, Beijing, February 10: Xi Jinping, General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee, President of the People's Republic of China, and Chairman of the Central Military Commission, sent a letter to the members of the 19th Chinese medical team assisting African republics on February 9, extending greetings and expressing heartfelt expectations to them and to the vast number of medical workers engaged in overseas aid.

In his reply, Xi Jinping said, "Yourself and your team have overcome difficulties in work and life and have served the local people with dedication. You are not only angels of mercy in white clothes, but also messengers of friendship."

This year marks the 60th anniversary of the dispatch of the Chinese medical teams to provide aid overseas. A sincere greeting is hereby extended to comrades who are currently or have previously performed tasks related to providing overseas medical aid.
Xi Jinping pointed out that the Chinese people love peace and cherish life, and providing medical aid to other countries is a vivid manifestation of this.

I hope that you all will not forget your original intentions and keep in mind your mission, vigorously promote the spirit of the Chinese medical teams who are unafraid of hardship, willing to make sacrifices, dedicated to saving lives and helping the injured, and showing great love without boundaries. Use a benevolent heart and skilled techniques to benefit the local people, use concrete actions to tell the Chinese story well, and make greater contributions to the construction of a global community for health and well
Providing medical assistance is an important part of our country's foreign aid work.
In 1963, our country dispatched the first medical aid team to Algeria.

Over the past 60 years, a total of 30,000 medical personnel have been sent to 76 countries and regions in Africa, Asia, the Americas, Europe, and Oceania, treating 290 million patients and earning widespread praise from the international community.
Currently, overseas medical aid teams are working in 115 medical facilities across 56 countries worldwide, with nearly half of them in remote and harsh areas.

Recently, 11 members of the 19th batch of Chinese medical teams providing aid to Africa wrote a letter to General Secretary Xi Jinping, reporting on their efforts to study and implement the spirit of the 20th Party Congress and provide medical services to local residents, and expressing their determination to contribute to the construction of a global health community for all.

Google's AI Chatbot "Answers Incorrectly," Company's Stock Value Evaporates Billions of Dollars.
(Comprehensive report on the 11th day)

Google's newly launched AI chatbot, Bard, had an unfortunate debut, giving incorrect answers in a promotional video, causing Alphabet's stock to plummet 8.9% on Tuesday, falling below the $100 mark, and wiping out $110 billion in market value (approximately 4765 billion yen). The stock closed at $94.57 on Friday.
The market is concerned that Alphabet (Google's parent company) is not keeping up with competitor Microsoft.

According to a Reuters report, Google previously released a promotional clip on social media featuring its AI chatbot, Bard, in which someone asks Bard: "What new discoveries about the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) can I tell my 9-year-old child?"
Bard mentioned in the answer that this telescope captured the first photograph of a planet outside our solar system.

However, according to data from the US National Aeronautics and Space Administration, the first photograph of a planet outside our solar system was taken by the "Very Large Telescope" of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
"Reuters Reports 'Alphabet Stock Plummets After Bard Answers Incorrectly'"

On the other hand, Google emphasized that Bard's response "highlights the importance of a rigorous testing process." It will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's responses "meet high standards in terms of quality, safety, and accurate information."
Singapore's tourism industry is recovering strongly, with the number of incoming passengers growing 19 times compared to 2021.

(According to a recent announcement) The Singapore Tourism Board has projected that the number of international visitors to Singapore in 2023 could reach 12-14 million, bringing in approximately SGD 18-21 billion in tourism revenue. This would restore visitor numbers and revenue to around 67%-75% of pre-Covid-19 levels in 2019. The likelihood of a full recovery of the tourism
The Singapore tourism market is gradually restarting and recovering in 2022.

The Singapore Tourism Board's latest statistics show that the number of arrivals in 2022 has grown 19 times from 33.06 thousand in 2021, reaching 630 thousand, surpassing the earlier estimate of 400 to 600 thousand, and the number of tourists has recovered to 33% of the pre-epidemic level.

Tourism revenue in Singapore from January to September 2022 reached SGD 89.6 billion, with an estimated full-year revenue of SGD 138-143 billion, a 6-7 fold increase from SGD 18.9 billion in 2021, and recovering to approximately 50-52% of the level before the COVID-19 outbreak in 2019.
The Singaporean government has implemented multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced a grant of nearly 5 billion new Taiwan dollars to stimulate the recovery of the tourism industry.
The tourism bureau recently announced that it plans to allocate 110 million NTD from the budget to launch more commercial and leisure activities to attract tourists to return in the next two years.

In order to make health and wellness a new tourist attraction for Singapore, the Singapore Tourism Board released a proposal on November 23, 2022, for an intention to solicit activities, with plans to develop a health and wellness spot in the southern coast of Singapore.

The executive director of the Singapore Tourism Board's Sports, Tourism and Entertainment Group, Wang Lingli, said that in recent years, an increasing number of tourists have prioritized physical health above other considerations.

Developing a health and wellness tourist spot in the coastal southern district of Singapore, which features the Bay Garden and the Bay Promenade, has the potential to contribute to Singapore's tourism industry and economy, encouraging tourists to spend and stay longer in Singapore.
The chairman of the Singapore Tourism Board, Chen Buildong, stated that in the next few years, health and wellness will become an important component of Singapore's tourism products.
The COVID-19 pandemic has raised public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
Therefore, over the past two years, the tourism board has been promoting health and wellness programs to both local residents and international tourists.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first-ever Healthy Living Festival, offering over 130 various health-related activities and experiences to the public.
Singapore will continue to offer new travel experiences for tourists.

Apart from the newly opened Singapore Children's Museum, the Avatar World at Gardens by the Bay, the Central Beach Bazaar at Sentosa, and the new "Explore New Frontiers" exhibit hall at the ArtScience Museum, as well as the newly constructed open-air theater at the Night Safari, the tourism board will support the development and updating of the Bird Park at Jurong Bird Park, among other projects, to make Singapore an attractive international

According to the plan, Singapore will formulate relevant industry standards for the meetings, exhibitions, and incentive travel sectors focused on sustainable development by the end of 2023, with a particular emphasis on improving waste management and reducing carbon emissions, further optimizing the tourism environment.
The recovery of Singapore's tourism industry has accelerated the revival of the aviation industry.

Data shows that as of December 18, 2022, the passenger traffic at Changi Airport has strongly recovered, with daily arrivals of up to 150,000 passengers and approximately 100,000 passengers per week, which is around 75% of the pre-Covid-19 level. The number of airline employees has also recovered to about 90% of the pre-epidemic level

Data shows that from January to October 2022, Singapore has welcomed 23.60 million travelers, which is equivalent to 42% of the pre-Covid-19 level, and there have been 170,000 take-off and landing flights, which is 53% of the pre-epidemic level.
The recovery of the tourism industry has also accelerated the revival of related industries such as accommodation, transportation, dining, and shopping.
The Singaporean government and the tourism industry hold high hopes for the Chinese market.

The assistant director of the International Division of the Singapore Tourism Board, Ms. Ker Bee Shan, stated that a survey conducted by a Chinese travel platform revealed that Singapore's safety index ranks among the top three globally, which is one of the reasons why Singapore is deeply loved by Chinese tourists.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, approximately 360 million people traveled from China to Singapore for tourism each year.
With China easing border policies, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists this year will recover to 30% to 60% of the 2019 level.
Ko Shu-dan pointed out that next, the Tourism Bureau will closely monitor any further signals released by China regarding outbound travel policies, in order to respond to changes in tourist demand.

The Singapore Tourism Board is not only strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies like Ctrip, but also actively preparing to welcome Chinese tourists amid emerging trends of outbound travel from China.

Looking ahead to the 2023 tourism market, the Singapore Tourism Board is optimistic and believes that as long as the global economy does not experience a significant downturn affecting personal income and there are no new widespread fatal outbreaks, the recovery of the tourism industry will be faster than expected.

"E Fund Account" Arrives: CSRC Authorizes Development for Collection and Inquiry of All Funds Under Investor's Name - Economic Observation Network - Professional Financial News Website
The Economic Observation Network reporter, Chen Shen: Is the difficulty in collecting account information due to the numerous channels for purchasing funds?
Forgot your "Piggy Bank" again?
The residents' issues are about to be resolved.
On February 10, the China Securities Regulatory Commission announced that the "E-account for funds" app has been listed on various mobile app stores and is conducting public beta testing.

According to the introduction, "Fund E Account" provides a "one-stop" inquiry service for public fund account and shareholding information for individual investors, aiming to address the pain points of forgetting accounts and cumbersome inquiries in the industry service for general small and medium-sized investors.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there are 156 domestically licensed mutual fund management companies in China, managing a scale of approximately 26 trillion yuan; there are 167 mutual fund share registration institutions, and 411 mutual fund sales institutions.
The account systems of various registration authorities operate independently, lacking a unified industry query channel.
Industry insiders have stated that by the end of 2021, the number of fund investors in China had exceeded 720 million, meaning that half of the country's population had invested in fund products.

Previously, investors had to inquire about purchasing conditions through different sales channels. However, by using a "fund E account," all purchasing situations across all sales channels can be queried, making the holding of fund situations immediately clear.
"What is the 'E Account' App for Funds?"

According to related files, the "Fund E Account" app is a mobile application for the public fund industry approved for development and construction by the China Securities Regulatory Commission, which can provide investors with a one-stop query of the holding situation of public fund products outside the market.

Investors can conveniently and quickly grasp their holdings of publicly offered mutual fund products managed by various fund companies purchased through various sales channels across the market, through the "E Account for Funds," thereby significantly improving their query efficiency.

Specifically, investors can obtain the following information through the "Fund E Account": information about fund accounts opened with various public fund management companies in the market, transaction account information held with public fund sales institutions, and the off-exchange holding situation of products such as publicly offered securities investment funds and investment products established and managed by securities companies that are not subject to a limit of 200 investors, such as collective asset management plans.

According to Liu Yiqian, the business head of the Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation and Research Center, investors can obtain comprehensive information about their holdings of all off-exchange publicly offered funds through the "Fund E Account" App, aiding in the recovery of "forgotten assets." More importantly, it has enabled the collection of comprehensive fund investment information for all accounts, helping customers to more promptly, accurately, and comprehensively grasp their own investment situation, thereby
How to register and use?

Reporters noticed that the "E-fund account" app is currently available for download in the app stores of Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, and vivo, but it is still in the public testing phase. To register, users need to fill out an invitation code, which investors can obtain from the fund management company that manages their fund.

A customer service representative from a large mutual fund company in Shanghai provided a six-digit invitation code to a reporter from Jingji Guancha Network and told the reporter, "During the trial operation stage, China Securities provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund management company. Investors can obtain them by calling, and we will provide them."
After the trial run ends, there will be no need for an invitation code when user registration is opened.
I'm sorry, I need the Chinese source text in order to provide an English translation. Could you please provide the Chinese text you would like me to translate? Thank you.

Reporters registered for an "E Account" on the official website of the China Securities Regulatory Commission and completed the query in just a few minutes, with the process consisting of four main steps: user registration, real-name authentication, bond fund account binding, and public fund query.

After completing real-name verification, click the "Assets - Fund Binding" button. The reporter found that all fund products purchased through various fund sales platforms appear in the bound option list (can be bound to an account). Once the binding is complete, you can clearly see the total assets of the invested funds and start using the query function.
It is worth noting that the "E Fund Account" only provides querying services for investors and does not support redemption, subscription, or trading.
The data date displayed in account E of the fund generally is the date of user inquiry (T day) minus three trading days.

For example, if you open a "Fund E Account" on February 10, the total assets, fund shares, and fund net value displayed on the asset page correspond to the date that is three trading days prior to that date, which is February 7.

The US, Japan, and the Philippines Reach a Consensus on Defense Against the CCP.
Asia - On February 9, Philippine President Bongbong Marcos visited Japan and held talks with Prime Minister Fumio Kishida.

The leaders of the Philippines and Japan have reached a consensus in opposing the Chinese Communist Party's invasion of the South China Sea and the East China Sea. Following the meeting, they released a joint statement, stating that they will engage in substantial defense exchanges with the United States through the signing of a trilateral defense agreement, and oppose China's hegemonic policy.
Based on Japanese media reports, Fumio Kishida hopes to use this meeting to help Japan and the Philippines establish policies addressing the Taiwan Strait crisis.
Xiao Ma Ke Si (Jack Ma) visited China in early January this year and obtained agreements worth 200 billion US dollars.
But after that, China-Philippine relations did not improve as expected, instead they worsened.

At the beginning of this month, the Philippines and the United States signed an agreement allowing for the expansion of access to military bases for the American military, in order to ensure security in the South China Sea.
An newly added base is located 300 kilometers away from Taiwan, making it the closest point to China.
If a crisis occurs in Taiwan, the US military may launch operations from bases in the Philippines.

Japanese media believes that Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, Australia, and even the Philippines have now formed an axis with the United States, building a "counter-China arc" in the Western Pacific to promote regional cooperation.
Vice Chairman of the Kuomintang, Xia Liangwan, conveyed Song Tao's words during his visit to China: Under the "92 Consensus," we welcome the DPP to visit the mainland.

Taiwan's Kuomintang Vice Chairman Xia Liyan has recently met with China's State Council Taiwan Affairs Office Director Song Tao and Chinese Communist Party Central Political Bureau member Wang Huning.

Yesterday evening, Zhao Chunshan, a senior advisor to the official KMT (Kuomintang) institution, the National Policy Foundation, gave an interview to the Central News Agency of Taiwan. He positively evaluated Song Tao's statement that if the DPP (Democratic Progressive Party) recognizes the "1992 Consensus" and opposes Taiwan independence, China welcomes DPP members to visit the mainland.
The Kuomintang side evaluates it as something fresh.
"Summer Lijuan met with Song Tao earlier, but the news from that day made no mention of this statement."
The ruling Democratic Progressive Party in Taiwan has repeatedly clarified its rejection of the "92 Consensus."

According to the Central News Agency today, Kuomintang (KMT) Vice Chairman Chiang Lih-pen led a delegation to visit mainland China and met with Chinese Communist Party (CCP) Politburo Standing Committee member Wang Huning, new Director of the Taiwan Affairs Office Song Tao, and Beijing Municipal Committee Secretary Yin Li during his stay in Beijing.

Xia Li Juan met with Song Tao and discussed how the political foundation of the Nationalist and Communist parties is the "92 Consensus" and opposition to Taiwan independence. Zhao Chun Shan, a senior advisor to the Nationalist Party's National Policy Foundation, stated during the meeting that the Nationalist Party's "92 Consensus" is the original, unadulterated "92 Consensus."
Zhao Chunshan analyzed that this feels different from the meetings he had participated in before.

Recently, during a video conference with scholars from mainland China, as well as in this conversation, I did not hear any Taiwan experts mention "reunification by force" or the "anti-secession law." Instead, the focus was on resuming communication and dialogue.

Zhao Chunshan pointed out that the situation across the strait is tense and fraught with danger, and mainland China hopes to convey its intention to improve cross-strait relations through the Kuomintang.

"Because there is no mutual trust between the mainland and Taiwan, the other side still wants to do a good job for the people of Taiwan, which shows that they do not wish to harm cross-strait relations."

According to Zhao Chunshan, Wang Huning also personally instructed Song Tao to say, "You must definitely implement the demands raised by the Taiwanese fishermen. If a comprehensive solution cannot be achieved, case-by-case handling should be adopted."

The report did not mention whether Kuomintang officials brought up the daily harassment of Taiwan by Chinese military aircraft and ships, the agricultural and fishing issues in Taiwan's scarcely populated counties and cities, or if the Central News Agency reporter asked such questions.
The labor union is once again mobilizing a large-scale protest against the government's retirement reform plan.

On Saturday (February 11), French unions once again launched a nationwide mobilization to protest the French government's proposed reform of the pension system, urging citizens to take to the streets to express their opinions.
This is the fourth action day of the social movement opposing the government's pension reform proposal.
The number of people who responded to the rallying cry could potentially impact the labor unions' next course of action.

This is the fourth time in a month that a coalition of eight major French trade unions has jointly launched a nationwide mobilization, and it is also the first time that this protest activity has scheduled the rally on a Saturday.

Given that for most French people, Saturday is a day off, and they do not need to choose between attending a protest and going on strike while being docked pay, therefore labor unions hope that today's gathering will attract more people to participate.

Today, the unions of the public transportation system, subway, and state-owned railways have not called for a strike, so the public transportation system should operate normally, allowing citizens to travel to the rally site. Additionally, in regions where schools are starting winter break, people can normally set off for their holidays.

Trade unions hope that more than one million people will participate in the rally today, while the police expect the national turnout to be between 600,000 and 800,000, with 90,000 to 120,000 people possibly gathering in the Paris city center.

Since the protests against the French government's pension reform plan began, although polls show that the majority of French people do not support the measure to delay the statutory retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people truly taking to the streets to participate in the demonstrations has gradually decreased.
The first strike protest on January 31st rallied approximately 127,000 to 250,000 people across the country.
The crowd of protesters this past Tuesday (February 7) had shrunk to between 75,000 and 200,000 people nationwide.
This pension reform plan is currently being discussed in the French National Assembly.
In the opposition party, especially the left-wing faction, numerous amendment proposals have been submitted, causing the legislative process to progress very slowly.
The debate between the ruling and opposition parties is becoming increasingly intense and sharp.

A radical left-wing party politician in France recently posted a picture on social media of themselves standing on a balloon imprinted with the face of the Labor Minister, causing protests from the ruling party.
The speaker of the National Assembly ultimately announced a 15-day ban on this member's participation in legislative activities as a punishment for their behavior.

Although this reform plan has triggered the largest social uproar in France in the past 20 years, so far the government has made only minor adjustments to the proposal and has not made any significant concessions.
The union has prepared to take action again on the following Thursday, March 16, and also plans to organize a protest on March 7, when the reform proposal is submitted to the Senate for discussion.

On September 9, the Yunnan Provincial Sperm Bank in China issued a public appeal for college graduates or current students with higher education degrees to donate sperm. Successful donors who donate 8 to 12 times can receive a subsidy of 4500 yuan in Chinese currency.

According to a report signed by China's Freedom Times, China encourages college students to donate sperm.

The requirement for sperm donation in various colleges is that in Beijing, the highest threshold is implemented, in addition to requiring a certain educational background, it also stipulates a height of 170 centimeters or above, well-proportioned facial features, no obvious hair loss, and a near-sightedness degree of no more than 600 degrees.

According to the report, Yunnan Province's human sperm bank stated that sperm donors can receive a full set of male reproductive system check-ups worth 1000 yuan, "especially semen and chromosome testing, which most people have never done before. Understanding one's own reproductive status is of great significance."

Donor requirements include: height of 165 cm or above, education of college degree or higher (or currently enrolled), no color blindness or color weakness, and no genetic or infectious diseases such as hepatitis B.

The report, citing China News Service, states that a poster reading "Donating sperm for pay is an unlimited honor" was printed at the human sperm bank in Shaanxi Province, encouraging young people to respond to the call for sperm donation and urging netizens to share the related information to "spread love."

In Shaanxi Province, those who are qualified can receive 300 yuan in cash each time the sperm donation price is higher than in Yunnan. Once a certain number of donations have been completed, donors can receive a 5000 yuan subsidy.
And currently, it is known that the highest price code is in Beijing, with the maximum subsidy of 5150 yuan.

On November 13, 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall that had divided East and West Berlin for 28 years was opened, Mikhail Gorbachev stated that he would assist in turning East Germany into a democratic nation.
At that time, due to protesters in East Germany demanding democracy and freedom, Communist Party leaders were forced to step down.
After coming to power in the Soviet Union, Mikhail Gorbachev called for reforms to be carried out in Eastern Europe under Soviet leadership.
In March 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic (GDR).
The election results caused him to no longer serve as prime minister.
Despite Modero's reforms, critics accuse him of trying to postpone the political changes and unification that occurred in October 1990.
He was criticized for trying to reform rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Moduro was found guilty of election fraud in the May 1989 municipal election, but was not imprisoned.
Some claim that these accusations are politically motivated.
Modi considers himself a reformer and hopes to bring about change from within the Communist Party.
In 1999, he told Reuters that he did not wish for East Germany to reunify, but expressed that East Germany's achievements should be recognized.
Moderato was born in the German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica, Poland) in 1928 and received mechanical training.

During World War II, he served as a platoon leader of the Youth Fire Brigade and became a member of the Nazi paramilitary organization Volkssturm near the end of the conflict, which conscripted men aged 16 to 60 to participate in the final struggle of the war.

At the age of 17, Mandela was captured by the Soviet Union's military and, as a prisoner of war, was taken to the Soviet Union. There, he participated in an anti-fascist program and became a dedicated Communist Party member.

In 1949, the year that East Germany was established, he returned to his country and found a job as a mechanical engineer, continuing his studies in social sciences and economics, and eventually earning a PhD.

"Does the balloon incident shine a brighter light on America?"

The disaster relief efforts for the earthquake in Turkey and Syria continue from night to day.

After the earthquake in Syria, which borders Turkey, rescue teams from several dozen countries have been working tirelessly day and night among the rubble of thousands of destroyed buildings, rescuing survivors buried under the debris.
In the cold temperature, they often urge to keep quiet because they are exhausting themselves trying to hear any sign of life from the crumbling concrete pile.
According to a Reuters report today, two women were rescued alive from the earthquake ruins several days after the disaster.
However, the death toll from the earthquake climbed to 24,150 people.
The death toll in Turkey is 20,665 people, while in Syria it exceeds 3,500 people.

A 7.8-magnitude earthquake occurred on Monday, followed by several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria. This is the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the earthquake and tsunami in Japan in 2011 and approaching the 31,000 deaths caused by the earthquake in neighboring Iran in 2003.
In 1999, a strong earthquake similar to the one in Turkey's northwest region caused over 17,000 deaths.

Turkish authorities announced on Saturday that two women who were trapped in the rubble of a collapsed building for 122 hours were rescued by rescue teams following the most deadly earthquake in the region in 20 years.
Another injured 55-year-old man was identified as Masallah Cicek, who was rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, the largest city in southeastern Turkey.
Rescuers often urge maintaining silence in cold temperatures because they are exhausting themselves trying to hear any signs of life from the pile of crumbled concrete.

In the Samandag district of Turkey, rescue workers crouched under a concrete slab, whispering "Inshallah" - "God willing" - as they carefully extended their hands into the rubble and rescued a 10-day-old newborn.
He opened his wide eyes, baby Yagiz Ulas was wrapped in a heating blanket and carried into the battlefield hospital.
The emergency responders also took away his mother, who was feeling dizzy and weak, with a pale face but was still conscious, as shown on the video display.

Vice President of Turkey, Fuat Oktay, told reporters last night that in the past 24 hours, 67 people have been rescued from the rubble, and a total of 31,000 rescue workers have been deployed in the disaster-stricken area.

He said that approximately 80,000 people are receiving treatment in the hospital, while 1.05 million people have lost their homes due to the earthquake and are taking shelter in temporary evacuation sites.
Due to many people lacking food in harsh winter conditions, public skepticism of the disaster response from the leaders of the two countries has been growing.

According to official Syrian media, Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his wife Asma visited a hospital in Aleppo, according to reports, marking his first visit to a disaster-stricken area since the earthquake.

Several months ago, the World Food Programme stated that due to the complexity of relief work caused by the war-like situation, its stocks in northwest Syria, under the control of rebel forces, were about to run out.
On Friday, Erdoğan visited the Adana province of Turkey, where he admitted that the government's response had not met the expected speed.
Opponents are seizing on this issue to attack Erdoğan, who is set to run for re-election in the vote scheduled for May 14th, but may be postponed due to the disaster.
Reuters has reported that anger over the delay in providing assistance and initiating rescue efforts could influence the election.
Even before the earthquake occurred, the election was already considered the most formidable challenge to Erdoğan's rule in the past twenty years.
Elduan urged for unity and condemned what he called "negative movements made for political gain."
The leader of Turkey's main opposition party, Kemal Kılıçdaroğlu, criticizes the government's response.
Critics say that "the earthquake is huge, but even more severe than the earthquake are the lack of coordination, lack of planning, and incompetence."

What was the "object" that was shot down over Alaska?
In a daze, with guesses multiplying.

On Friday afternoon (February 10), the U.S. military once again deployed the United States' most advanced stealth jet fighter, the F-22, and shot down an unidentified object flying in U.S. airspace over Alaska.
The location of the crash is ten miles away from the Alaskan coast.
This is the second time in under a week that the US military has shot down an aerial object.
Last Saturday, a Chinese spy balloon spent several days drifting in US airspace before it was destroyed over the coast of South Carolina in the United States.

The Pentagon stated that the second object to be shot down entered US airspace for the first time on Thursday evening and was tracked by the US military as it moved over northeastern Alaska at an altitude of 1.2 kilometers (40,000 feet). Its size is roughly similar to that of a small car, and it is much smaller than the first Chinese spy balloon that was shot down.
The Pentagon still does not see any evidence indicating that this object is controllable.

White House National Security Council Strategic Communications Coordinator John Kirby stated on Friday that, while the specific appearance of the object flying at high altitude is not clear, it "poses a reasonable threat to the safety of civilian aircraft."
Kobe stated that this object is different from the spy balloon discovered within the US, as it does not have any "payload" hanging from it.
Kobe says, "We refer to it as an 'object' because that's the best description we can make at the moment."
Before President Biden ordered the object to be shot down, he had sought advice from the Pentagon and made the decision "very cautiously," Kobe added.

The official description of this object in the United States can be summarized as: it is approximately the size of a small car, has no control stick, no suspension device, and flies at an altitude of around ten thousand meters.
However, this information is still unable to answer basic questions such as what this object actually is, which country it belongs to, and what task it is performing.
Currently, many analyses and guesses believe that this may be another Chinese balloon.

It is possible that both the spy balloon that invaded American airspace and the balloon floating over Latin America originated from China, and they are performing certain tasks at different locations.
Some people have associated this "object" in Alaska with "unidentified flying objects" (UFOs).
"I really hope this 'unidentified flying object' is a spy balloon, not a legitimate UFO," former U.S. Representative Peter Meijer tweeted on Friday, according to a report by TIME Magazine.
"The satirical meaning of equating alien spaceships with weather balloons is surprising, but it's not worth causing an interstellar conflict," Meijie said.
Meijie posted this tweet shortly after Kobe confirmed that this object in Alaska had been shot down.
Newsweek reports that the suspicion that this object is a UFO is not limited to Meier alone.

Representative Tim Burchett of the Tennessee Republican Party criticized the government's handling of concealing intelligence last month and called for the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) to release a report on "unidentified flying objects."

After opening, the paper felt somewhat loose, and there was a noticeable difference compared to imported Pampers. I suspect that there's something wrong with the quality of the two items in the box.
I will probably not continue to buy (any more) in the future!

When I was in sophomore year, I read this book with a bored attitude, thinking that I probably wouldn't get addicted to this type of book, as I wasn't particularly attracted to web novels before.
Then...fell into a pit/hole.

According to this plot, the whole book is relatively lighthearted and carefree. Even when Lei Xiu was still playing online games, there was internal strife between guilds, but it was never taken too seriously because Lei Shen's overwhelming strength always turned the situation around.
As for the competition itself, I wrote about the bittersweet feelings brought about by the changing times and the passing of the old and the new (perhaps it's my melancholic nature).
I spent a significant amount of my high school sophomore (grade 10) learning time on reading this entire book, but I just couldn't stop.

The detailed portrayal of characters and emotional storylines in the full-time series is truly stunning. Even minor characters who only briefly appear can leave a lasting impression, such as the main characters Lei Xiu, Huang Shao Tian, Su Mu, and Cheng. Even characters who are not central to the plot, like Jiang Bo Tao and Chu Yun Xiu, have their own fans. In a lively and entertaining story about e-sports,

As for the romantic plotline, Full-Time does not have the common issues found in online novels, such as an excessive harem of beautiful, corrupt women. Instead, all the characters share a commonality in their affection: they enjoy the glory of the game and mostly desire an honorable and straightforward victory.
There's no grand conspiracy in small acts of dishonesty; everyone just seems so innocent and endearing.
This might also be why there are no truly annoying characters in a full-time [job/position].

I read this a long time ago and happened to jot down my impressions from memory.
This book is more accurately described as a collection of fragments on the topic of love, rather than a collection of short stories.

The tone of this book is extremely bland, like plain hot water, with its diction and sentence structure pursued to the extreme of simplicity. The plot is also as quiet and mundane as a summer afternoon street.
Each short story is a snapshot of a mundane life's moment in time, with no beginning and no ending.
Collected at the end and titled "What We're Really Talking About When We Talk About Love."

I think, this collection of short stories, along with its title, is akin to performance art, where the author aims to express that love is not only the joy and sorrow of the stage, or the rock-bottom desperation of urban legends, nor is it just the sticky-sweet exchanges of "you" and "me." Love is not only those things, nor should it be represented by them. Love is also the mundane monotony of everyday
Reading this book may bring to mind bickering spouses beside you, the tasteless marriages of acquaintances, and unrequited feelings.

This is the reason I do not recommend reading this book; from an aesthetic perspective, its writing style and plot are both bland and uninteresting. Unless your life is filled with thrilling adventures or is as sweet as living in a candy castle, your feeling while reading will be one of indifference and boredom.

And from a depth of thought, the plot does not make one's eyes light up or expand a person's perspective and vision (unlike Marquez's "Love in the Time of Cholera"), and fleeting fragments do not discuss any issues, such as what kind of mistakes led to the failure of love.
What were the reasons for the breakdown of the protagonist's marriage?
Therefore, I do not recommend reading this book, as it doesn't have much significance whether you read it or not.
The author's ideas are expressed more through techniques and styles rather than the plot of the story, which is one of the reasons for the less satisfying reading experience of this book.
Suitable for a quick read, not for close examination.
The logic of this book is good, but its content is not sufficiently substantial.
The explanation of many sales theories is thorough, but it is weak in terms of what to do and only points out the direction without providing specific actions.
Additionally, the book feels as if it was patched together.
For instance, there are both domestic and foreign examples; both famous entrepreneurs or salespeople and those who are unknown to the public.
I don't know if it's a compiled story intended as an example, but using some cases experienced by the author would be more convincing.
There is a constant shift in whether to refer to them as customers or guests.
The title still refers to the customer, but it changes to "customer" in the main body.
The electronic book also contains issues such as misspelled words, missing punctuation marks, and incorrect numbering.
In general, this book is a decent choice for a theoretical introduction, but it is not very suitable for those who are already engaged in sales work and want to improve their sales skills.
"A Guide to Understanding Internet Finance: A Quick Introduction"

This book is quite basic and can be considered an introductory course. It can help people quickly understand the overall picture of internet finance, but to gain a deeper understanding, one must still "take the bull by the horns" and conduct further research independently.

Given that the book was published relatively early, before the rise of the Alipay and WeChat "subsidy wars" that helped cultivate users' habits, it is likely that the current market share of third-party payment platforms is much larger than what is described in the book.
Nowadays, many people only need to bring their mobile phones when they go out to eat, as merchants have stopped using UnionPay due to high bank statements.

"Nevertheless, I would like to express my sincere gratitude to the author for writing this introductory book. The author's extensive experience in financial observation is evident, and they have a deep understanding of the historical development of finance both domestically and internationally, which enables them to create such accessible and comprehensible content."
Writing about the vast sky is easy, but making it understandable to the general public is the challenge.
I admire you and want you to know more!
The most important factor determining a person's job satisfaction is not the level of salary, but whether they receive adequate recognition and appreciation in their work.

According to Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs theory, once an individual's basic survival needs are met, the most pressing need becomes the satisfaction of psychological needs, such as the desire to be understood, acknowledged, and appreciated.
Indeed, for Chinese people, the majority are "love you but cannot say it," even if they harbor love, gratitude, and praise, they keep it in their hearts without expressing it.
In the book, the author discusses five languages of praise: affirmative words, thoughtful moments, service behaviors, heartfelt gifts, and physical touch.

I think what's important is not that you know what the five languages of appreciation are, but that you can genuinely and spontaneously use these five languages to express appreciation and gratitude towards the people around you, whether they are family members, friends, or colleagues.
Actually, the closer the relationship, the more we need to praise and express gratitude, as this will make our lives more beautiful.
Mastering the art of appreciation can help a company retain talent and reduce turnover to a certain extent.
Thank you, translator, for bringing us such fascinating foreign ideas and perspectives.

Due to differences in cultural background between Chinese and Western languages, there may be discrepancies between translations. If possible, I recommend checking out the author's original work to gain more insights.
Once again, I would like to thank the author, translator(s), and editors for their hard work!

The worst shopping experience in history.

On the evening of September 23, my wife's phone broke, and I spontaneously ordered a new one from Amazon - an 8p model. It was in stock, but not sold directly by Amazon and with no additional markup (which I secretly appreciated). However, since it wasn't sold directly by Amazon, the shipping would be slower, and the system estimated that the latest delivery date would be September 27.

My wife was extremely inconvenienced without her phone, so she woke me up early the next day (around 6:15 am) to figure out a solution. Later, I discovered that there was a 256G phone available on JD.com that could be delivered that same day, so I had no choice but to place another order right away.
I just bought a new one, and now I want to cancel my Amazon order immediately.

Due to the order being placed at midnight, it is not possible to come collect the express delivery in the early morning. At around 7:30, I contacted customer service to request the cancellation of the order. The customer service representative replied that the order has already been cancelled and to wait for the SMS notification.

Alright, I waited patiently, but when I checked my phone at noon, the order was still in the "unshipped" status. I immediately contacted customer service to request a cancellation, and the customer service representative replied that they had already processed the cancellation.

I checked my phone in the afternoon at 3 o'clock and saw that the order was still there. I had no choice but to contact customer service again to confirm that this was the third time I had called, and to request that they cancel the order and notify the seller not to ship it!

The customer service contacted the seller in my presence and informed me that the seller is not familiar with the system and needs to become familiar with it before they can process the cancellation of the order.
Rest assured, the seller has already been informed and will not ship the order.
I was speechless when I checked the order on Monday and found that it had already been shipped.
Unable to directly contact the seller, I had to call customer service again.
The following handling is beyond words, it's basically me saying one step and the customer service agent operating one step after.
The order is still in the status of being ready for delivery but refused by the recipient, and it is about to be delivered again!
" Won't Amazon take the initiative to follow up?"
"Anyway, the seller's company has already received the money, so it doesn't matter if they don't follow up."
I will definitely not make a prepayment for large items in the future, this is too much trouble.
It looks very nice.

I spent over two hours trying various router settings, but in the end, I was able to get it working using 360WIFI as an intermediary. During this time, I contacted Xiaomi's customer service, but they did not have a solution to this

Additionally, it's worth noting that I've seen user comments online stating that this camera supports a minimum of 8G storage card, and storage with a capacity smaller than that cannot be recognized. I hope everyone takes note of this.

I gave it 3 stars because I bought it when I was in my first love, we dated for almost 3 years before she left me last year, and I'm still not over it.

We have been together for almost three years, but she left me last year, and now when I think of her, I feel a sharp pain in my heart and a desire to leave this world. She was the first woman in my life, and she left a lifelong shadow and heartache that I still haven't been able to move past.

When buying this phone, I recalled two feelings I had at the time - the comfort in sharing joys and sorrows together, but now it's a regret that I can't bear to look back on. Perhaps that's just how life is - some people never want to encounter certain people or know certain things in their lifetime. But what can one do?

Every time I see a Samsung phone, I cannot help but think of her, and the pain comes rushing in and fills my whole body. I have never dared to spend more than 2,000 yuan on a phone, but I didn't hesitate to buy it for her. No matter how good it is for someone, but when she betrayed me, all the mountains of promises and seas of oaths vanished like smoke and clouds.
High-end domestic brands

Huawei is a gem among domestic products.

Note: "国货" (guó huò) means "domestic products" or "made-in-China goods." The word "精品" (jīng pǐn) means "gem," "top-quality product," or "fine article." In this context, it implies that Huawei is a high-quality brand among Chinese-made products.

The low-key boss and the company rely on technical expertise and quality to win over customers, which is completely different from the current business culture that relies on advertising to increase name recognition!
A company without capability cannot and does not dare to do such a thing!
It was because of this that I chose Huawei.
I've been using it for more than half a year, and I feel that it has been great, very good.

The reason for not getting a perfect score is that there was an instance where the offline navigation feature failed to determine my location, and I was unable to find the cause. Other than that, it has worked well.

Plus, its online input of destinations allows it to automatically design a route after searching, and its offline navigation function is very useful when you set off without wifi, as it can locate and navigate directly through communication with satellites, without consuming data. It's great!

Sony's low-end models have a very strong design sense, are affordably priced, have a large screen, and have excellent battery life, making them very suitable for the elderly to use.
